{"step_by_step_thinking": "A free gingival graft is a procedure where a thin layer of tissue is removed from the palate of the mouth and then relocated to the area of gum recession. The epithelium of the graft is not removed by the surgeon, it remains as part of the graft. Over time, the epithelium of the graft will proliferate to cover the exposed root surface and to blend with the surrounding tissue. It does not degenerate.", "answer_choice": "B. Proliferates"}
